section.section:
A person may register:
a class of returnable containers if:
the person owns or deals in goods handled or delivered in a returnable container; and
the returnable container has an identifying name, mark, or device securely attached, impressed, or imprinted; or
a class of returnable textiles, if the person:
is in the business of regularly supplying clean laundered returnable textiles; and
periodically exchanges the clean returnable textiles for soiled returnable textiles.
A person who has registered a returnable container or returnable textile under State law is not required to reregister the returnable container or returnable textile.

text.section:
To register a returnable container or returnable textile a person shall:
prepare a clear statement of the character of the returnable container or returnable textile; and
prepare a comprehensive description of the identifying name, mark, or device attached, impressed, imprinted, woven, or produced;
sign and acknowledge the comprehensive description before an officer qualified to take an acknowledgment to deeds in the State;
publish the signed and acknowledged comprehensive description:
in two successive issues, in different weeks, of a newspaper published in the county in which the principal office, place of business, or agency of the person is located; or
twice a week for 2 successive weeks in a daily newspaper published in Baltimore City if the principal office, place of business, or agency of the person is located in Baltimore City; and
file with the Secretary of State the comprehensive description and a certificate of publication, certified by the owner or manager of the newspaper in which the comprehensive description was published.
A person may transfer a registration by filing a copy of the assignment or transfer with the Secretary of State.

section.section:
The Secretary of State shall record each:
comprehensive description filed under subsection (b) of this section;
certificate of publication filed under subsection (b) of this section; and
transfer filed under subsection (c) of this section.
On application, the Secretary of State shall provide to the applicant a certified copy of a recorded filing.

The Secretary of State shall establish reasonable fees:
for recording under this section; and
for providing copies of records filed under this section.

text.section:
A certified copy of a comprehensive description and a certificate of publication or of a transfer with the seal of the Secretary of State attached is:
evidence that the person complied with this subtitle; and
prima facie evidence of:
title to or right to use, collect, or deliver the corresponding returnable containers; and
title to the corresponding returnable textiles.
